intro: Coussarea congestiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered coussarea, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
